dayInfo.description: Zagreb is a charming middle-European city where the irresistible flair of the grandiose Austro-Hungarian Empire meets the lively energy of the Mediterranean. Habsburg-era buildings line the city streets with a historic appeal, while fancy parks reminiscent of Vienna will invite you for a retreat from a city hubbub. Zagreb is an inspiring historic site but also a dynamic cosmopolitan city. Upon your arrival at the airport, you will be met and transferred to the hotel to experience the exuberant and hospitable ambiance. Zagreb events brighten up the streets with music, tasteful street food, artistic decorations, and a good mood.

dayInfo.title: Split - Enjoy Plitvice Lakes National Parkâs Charm
dayInfo.description: Halfway between Split and Zagreb is the most beautiful place in Croatiaâs hinterland, Plitvice Lakes National Park. The fairy tale landscape has 16 lakes interconnected with nearly 90 spectacular waterfalls framed by lush greenery. Plitvice offers a delightful walk along 18 kilometers of beautiful wooden footbridges and pathways. Walking along the crystalline lakes and besides magical waterfalls will immerse you in the tranquility of the perfectly turquoise water, misty waterfalls, and bountiful shades of green. The National Park also shines with covered beech, fir, and spruce forest hosting deer, bears, wolves, boars, and numerous rare bird species.

dayInfo.title: Split - Explore Dynamic Split and Trogir
dayInfo.description: After a tasty breakfast, you will have an exciting walking tour through the beautiful city. Split is the second biggest city in Croatia and a former stronghold of the Holy Roman Empire. Your tour will reveal some of the most iconic places and fabled history. The narrow streets of the castle are filled with unsurpassable beauty. At Trogir, you will find a city rich and full of history, culture, and stunning architecture. Trogir will win over your heart with its 2,300-year-old streets surrounded by the city walls, originating from the age of Greeks and Romans.

The open-air gallery is an exhilarating visual feast of architecture and nature. Shaped by the cultural influence of Venice, the Austrian Empire, and authentic Dalmatia, your tour will start in Hvar town. Your excursion will end in picturesque Jelsa with a delectable wine tasting of indigenous rich wines paired with carefully selected food, followed by an authentic lunch at a restaurant that serves delicious Dalmatian food.

dayInfo.title: Dubrovnik - Visit Mali Ston en route to Dubrovnik
dayInfo.description: You will stop on the way to Dubrovnik in Mali Ston, well-known for its oyster and mussel cultivation. You will enjoy a short boat trip to oyster beds through the tranquil beauty of Ston Bay with an oyster tasting accompanied by delicious Dalmatian wine. A local guide will share his rich knowledge about the history of Ston, oyster cultivation, and the best ways to enjoy this precious seafood as you find the supple oyster texture pairs with the wineâs delicate stone fruit flavors.
